subject: Technology
title: HTML: The Language of Web Pages
description: A fast breakdown of HTML: The Language of Web Pages for builders.

hook.text: Every website you visit is built on the same simple language. It was designed to be easy, not powerful.

buildup.text: Before the web, creating electronic documents required expensive software. Only experts could do it.

discovery.text: HTML uses plain-text tags like <b> for bold and <a> for links. Anyone can learn it in an afternoon.

twist.text: Critics mocked HTML for being too simple. It couldn't do calculations or real programming.

climax.text: That simplicity was its superpower. Millions of non-programmers could suddenly make web pages.

punchline.text: The web grew fast because its language was simple.

quiz.question: Why did HTML succeed despite being simple?
options: It was the only option available
Its simplicity let millions of people create web pages
It was backed by a major corporation
